item.title: Covid: UK daily cases pass 50,000 for first time since January
item.description: England's chief medical officer has warned hospitalisations could hit "scary numbers" in the future.

item.title: Europe floods: At least 120 dead and hundreds unaccounted for
item.description: As many as 1,300 people are still unaccounted for after the worst flooding in decades.

item.title: Winter vomiting virus warning for England
item.description: Cases of norovirus are going up with a number of outbreaks caused by the vomiting bug in recent weeks, say officials.

item.title: Durham A1 crash: Three killed in six-vehicle collision
item.description: A lorry driver has been arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving.

item.title: Boris Johnson's university friend gets ethics watchdog role
item.description: Labour accuses Boris Johnson of "cronyism" but the government says proper processes were followed.

item.title: Racism in sport: Mo Farah says abuse towards black athletes is getting worse
item.description: Sir Mo says online trolls should be held to account and tech companies should take more action.

item.title: UK weather: Heat-health alert issued in England for weekend
item.description: Public Heath England wants people to look out for those who may be at risk in warmer weather.

item.title: Warnings grow about staff forced to self-isolate
item.description: Alarm mounts over fears of a "surge" in workers and medical staff forced to quarantine after being "pinged".

item.title: Church of England criticised over suicide of falsely accused priest
item.description: Fr Alan Griffin took his own life having spent a year under investigation over baseless allegations.

item.title: Cheshunt: Hunt continues for driver of car on rail line
item.description: The Land Rover Discovery was driven on railway tracks before it was abandoned.

item.title: GB News says presenter Guto Harri breached standards by taking the knee
item.description: Guto Harri is not expected to appear for the rest of the summer after making the gesture on air.

item.title: South Africa Zuma riots: Armed police protect food deliveries
item.description: Some $1bn worth of stock was stolen in KwaZulu-Natal and at least 800 shops looted, an official says.

item.title: In pictures: Floods kill dozens in Germany and Belgium
item.description: Record rainfall caused rivers to burst their banks, leaving at least 122 dead in Germany and Belgium.

item.title: Keir Starmer quizzed by former Labour voters in Blackpool
item.description: The Labour leader speaks to an audience in Blackpool about three of his policy priorities.

item.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories: Why Hollywood stars like Ryan Reynolds are lining up
item.description: Other stars to have taken part include Tom Hardy, Dolly Parton and Sir Elton John. Here's why.

item.title: Amy Winehouse documentary 10 years on from death shows 'more rounded image'
item.description: The late singer's father says he hopes a new documentary will show a "more rounded image" of Amy.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The gymnasts 'building bridges between cultures'
item.description: The town of Murayama in northern Japan is preparing to welcome a team of Bulgarian Olympians.

item.title: Llandudno goats sent to Bristol and Bournemouth to control numbers
item.description: Thirty Great Orme goats are moving to Bristol and Bournemouth after numbers boomed in lockdown.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Partner vows to keep searching for missing hiker
item.description: The partner of missing hiker Esther Dingley explains why he won't give up searching for her.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: Fleeing for fear of new ethnic conflict
item.description: "War is inevitable - it is ethnic cleansing," says an Ethiopian doctor who has escaped to Sudan.

item.title: 'I'm going to Ibiza by any means necessary'
item.description: The Balearic Islands joining the amber travel list for England is causing a dilemma for some holiday makers.

item.title: Finding 'Grace': Murder, DNA and ancestry
item.description: How a novel use of DNA and ancestry websites is helping police uncover clues in cold case murders.

item.title: Covid: Teaching has been 'lonely at times' during pandemic
item.description: Schools across Wales prepare to close for the summer holidays after "a very complicated year".

item.title: Formula 1 boss Ross Brawn says hydrogen could be future fuel
item.description: Hydrogen-powered cars could be the future of Formula 1 according to Ross Brawn, the F1 managing director for motorsports.

item.title: Dying alone in Indonesia's grim battle with Covid-19
item.description: Firefighters haul bodies from homes as hospitals scramble for oxygen in Asia's new Covid epicentre.

item.title: James Norton: Why making Nowhere Special made me sob and want children
item.description: The Grantchester actor on the emotional toll of playing a dying father and why he doesn't mind fame.

item.title: How your personal data is being scraped from social media
item.description: As hackers scoop up data from social media sites, should firms be taking better care of your data?

item.title: Verstappen sets searing Silverstone practice pace
item.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen sets an imposing pace in first practice at the British Grand Prix on Formula 1's new-format weekend.

item.title: 'Harry is our player. Period. No need to talk about anything else' - Spurs boss Nuno on Kane
item.description: New Tottenham manager Nuno Espirito Santo says Harry Kane is "our player" and will speak to the England captain when he returns to the club.

item.title: 'The wheels are off' if Lions lose on Saturday - Dawson
item.description: Former British and Irish Lion Matt Dawson says "the wheels are off the tour" if the side records a second loss against the Stormers on Saturday.

item.title: The Open 2021: Lee Westwood, Rory McIlroy and Brandt Snedeker feature in best shots from day one of the Open 2021
item.description: Lee Westwood, Rory McIlroy and Brandt Snedeker feature in the best shots from day one of the Open 2021 at Royal St. George's.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Adam Peaty creates his perfect playlist for the Games
item.description: Adam Peaty joins Radio 1's Reece Parkinson to create his perfect playlist for the Olympic Games.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing when restrictions end on 19 July?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules take effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks will no longer be compulsory in England from 19 July, but will remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: 'Indians don't talk about sex - so I help them'
item.description: An Indian sex coach says parents turn to her for advice as sex education is not available in schools.

item.title: Ghana's Kojo Marfo: Sell-out show for butcher-turned-painter
item.description: He's got rock star fans and two sold-out shows to his name, but Kojo Marfo prefers life's simple joys.

item.title: Fire lookouts: The US Forest Service lookouts watching for fires
item.description: In remote towers, US Forest Service lookouts act as an early warning system for forest fires.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Richard Branson's long, winding path to space
item.description: The BBC tracks the long, winding road to Sir Richard Branson's flight to the edge of space.

item.title: Bibaa and Nicole: The life after death of two sisters
item.description: Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman died in a senseless attack. But they should not be remembered as victims.
